name: Introduction to Scientific Computing

anti_reqs.name: Special Topics: Linear Algebra and Vector Calculus for Engineers

long_desc: This course provides an introduction to scientific computing with Matlab for engineers. The course introduces the basics of Matlab syntax and programming, data analysis, visualization, curve fitting and interpolation, symbolic computation, differential equations, and debugging. The use of Matlab in solving mechanical engineering applications will be demonstrated.

custom_fields.goals: Students will learn the fundamentals of computational science and how to solve engineering problems using Matlab.
custom_fields.key_topics: The course will show students the basics of scientific computing and how Matlab can be a useful tool for Engineers.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: There will be a graded homework assignment for each week's topics.
custom_fields.relevance: Scientific computing is ubiquitous in Mechanical and other kinds of Engineering currently. Matlab is also a useful tool that students can utilize in other courses.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Texts will be recommended, but not required. On-line manuals are widely available for the software. Handouts will be created and provided as needed
